segment.source: Advanced UEFI security features for Surface Pro 3 (Surface)
segment.target: Advanced UEFI security features for Surface Pro 3 (Surface)

segment.source: This article describes how to install and configure the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update to enable additional security options for Surface Pro 3 devices.
segment.target: This article describes how to install and configure the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update to enable additional security options for Surface Pro 3 devices.

segment.source: Advanced UEFI security features for Surface Pro 3
segment.target: Advanced UEFI security features for Surface Pro 3

segment.source: This article describes how to install and configure the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update to enable additional security options for Surface Pro 3 devices.
segment.target: This article describes how to install and configure the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update to enable additional security options for Surface Pro 3 devices.

segment.source: To address more granular control over the security of Surface devices, the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update provides additional security options that allow you to disable specific hardware devices or to prevent starting from those devices.
segment.target: To address more granular control over the security of Surface devices, the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update provides additional security options that allow you to disable specific hardware devices or to prevent starting from those devices.

segment.source: After the UEFI update is installed on a device, you can configure it manually or automatically by running a script.
segment.target: After the UEFI update is installed on a device, you can configure it manually or automatically by running a script.

segment.source: Manually install the UEFI update
segment.target: Manually install the UEFI update

segment.source: Before you can configure the advanced security features of your Surface device, you must first install the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update.
segment.target: Before you can configure the advanced security features of your Surface device, you must first install the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update.

segment.source: This update is installed automatically if you receive your updates from Windows Update.
segment.target: This update is installed automatically if you receive your updates from Windows Update.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure Windows to update automatically by using Windows Update, see How to configure and use Automatic Updates in Windows.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure Windows to update automatically by using Windows Update, see How to configure and use Automatic Updates in Windows.

segment.source: To update the UEFI on Surface Pro 3, you can download and install the Surface UEFI updates as part of the Surface Pro 3 Firmware and Driver Pack.
segment.target: To update the UEFI on Surface Pro 3, you can download and install the Surface UEFI updates as part of the Surface Pro 3 Firmware and Driver Pack.

segment.source: These firmware and driver packs are available from the Surface Pro 3 page on the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: These firmware and driver packs are available from the Surface Pro 3 page on the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: You can find out more about the firmware and driver packs at Download the latest firmware and drivers for Surface devices.
segment.target: You can find out more about the firmware and driver packs at Download the latest firmware and drivers for Surface devices.

segment.source: The firmware and driver packs are available as both self-contained Windows Installer (.msi) and archive (.zip) formats.
segment.target: The firmware and driver packs are available as both self-contained Windows Installer (.msi) and archive (.zip) formats.

segment.source: You can find out more about these two formats and how you can use them to update your drivers at Manage Surface driver and firmware updates.
segment.target: You can find out more about these two formats and how you can use them to update your drivers at Manage Surface driver and firmware updates.

segment.source: Manually configure additional security settings
segment.target: Manually configure additional security settings

segment.source: Note: To enter firmware setup on a Surface device, begin with the device powered off, press and hold the Volume Up button, then press and release the Power button, then release the Volume Up button after the device has begun to boot.
segment.target: Note: To enter firmware setup on a Surface device, begin with the device powered off, press and hold the Volume Up button, then press and release the Power button, then release the Volume Up button after the device has begun to boot.

segment.source: After the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update is installed on a Surface device, an additional UEFI menu named Advanced Device Security becomes available.
segment.target: After the v3.11.760.0 UEFI update is installed on a Surface device, an additional UEFI menu named Advanced Device Security becomes available.

segment.source: If you click this menu, the following options are displayed:
segment.target: If you click this menu, the following options are displayed:

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Available settings (default listed in bold)
segment.target: Available settings (default listed in bold)

segment.source: Network Boot
segment.target: Network Boot

segment.source: Enables or disables the ability of your Surface device to boot from the network (also known as PXE boot).
segment.target: Enables or disables the ability of your Surface device to boot from the network (also known as PXE boot).

segment.source: Enabled, Not Bootable
segment.target: Enabled, Not Bootable

segment.source: Side USB
segment.target: Side USB

segment.source: Enables or disables the USB port on the side of the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the USB port on the side of the Surface device.

segment.source: Additionally, the USB port can be enabled, but not allow booting.
segment.target: Additionally, the USB port can be enabled, but not allow booting.

segment.source: Enabled, Not Bootable, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Not Bootable, Disabled

segment.source: Docking Port
segment.target: Docking Port

segment.source: Enables or disables the ports on the Surface docking station.
segment.target: Enables or disables the ports on the Surface docking station.

segment.source: Additionally, the docking port can be enabled, but block booting from any USB or Ethernet port in the docking station.
segment.target: Additionally, the docking port can be enabled, but block booting from any USB or Ethernet port in the docking station.

segment.source: Enabled, Not Bootable, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Not Bootable, Disabled

segment.source: Front Camera
segment.target: Front Camera

segment.source: Enables or disables the camera on the front of the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the camera on the front of the Surface device.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: Rear Camera
segment.target: Rear Camera

segment.source: Enables or disables the camera on the rear of the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the camera on the rear of the Surface device.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: On Board Audio
segment.target: On Board Audio

segment.source: Enables or disables audio on the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables audio on the Surface device.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: microSD
segment.target: microSD

segment.source: Enables or disables the microSD slot on the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the microSD slot on the Surface device.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: WiFi
segment.target: WiFi

segment.source: Enables or disables the built-in Wi-Fi transceiver in the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the built-in Wi-Fi transceiver in the Surface device.

segment.source: This also disables Bluetooth.
segment.target: This also disables Bluetooth.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: Bluetooth
segment.target: Bluetooth

segment.source: Enables or disables the built-in Bluetooth transceiver in the Surface device.
segment.target: Enables or disables the built-in Bluetooth transceiver in the Surface device.

segment.source: Enabled, Disabled
segment.target: Enabled, Disabled

segment.source: Automate additional security settings
segment.target: Automate additional security settings

segment.source: As an IT professional with administrative privileges, you can automate the configuration of UEFI settings by leveraging Surface Pro 3 Firmware Tools (476 KB) available from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: As an IT professional with administrative privileges, you can automate the configuration of UEFI settings by leveraging Surface Pro 3 Firmware Tools (476 KB) available from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: These tools install a .NET assembly that can be called from any custom application or script.
segment.target: These tools install a .NET assembly that can be called from any custom application or script.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: The sample scripts below leverage the previously mentioned extension and therefore assume that the tool has been installed on the device being managed.
segment.target: The sample scripts below leverage the previously mentioned extension and therefore assume that the tool has been installed on the device being managed.

segment.source: The scripts must be run with administrative privilege.
segment.target: The scripts must be run with administrative privilege.

segment.source: The Windows PowerShell command Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted must be called prior to running sample scripts if they are not digitally signed.
segment.target: The Windows PowerShell command Set-ExecutionPolicy Unrestricted must be called prior to running sample scripts if they are not digitally signed.

segment.source: Sample scripts
segment.target: Sample scripts

segment.source: Note:The UEFI password used in the sample scripts below is presented in clear text.
segment.target: Note:The UEFI password used in the sample scripts below is presented in clear text.

segment.source: We strongly recommend saving the scripts in a protected location and running them in a controlled environment.
segment.target: We strongly recommend saving the scripts in a protected location and running them in a controlled environment.

segment.source: Show all configurable options:
segment.target: Show all configurable options:

segment.source: Set or change UEFI password:
segment.target: Set or change UEFI password:

segment.source: Check status of proposed changes:
segment.target: Check status of proposed changes:

segment.source: Revert UEFI to default values:
segment.target: Revert UEFI to default values:

segment.source: Status code interpretation
segment.target: Status code interpretation

segment.source: 00 - The proposed update was a success
segment.target: 00 - The proposed update was a success

segment.source: 02 - One of the proposed values had an invalid value
segment.target: 02 - One of the proposed values had an invalid value

segment.source: 03 - There was a proposed value set that was not recognized
segment.target: 03 - There was a proposed value set that was not recognized

segment.source: 0F - The unlock password did not match currently set password
segment.target: 0F - The unlock password did not match currently set password
